intro: Saurauia pseudopittieri, commonly known as the golden star holly, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, particularly in countries like Thailand and Vietnam. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and prefers shaded to semi-shaded environments. Saurauia pseudopittieri is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
